result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Jewell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - Defendant to serve the first 10 days, last 20 days STAYED.  To commence 2/15/2016 at 5:00 p.m.

treatment.

Defendant Brian L Jewell in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Guza advises the State is offering an amendment.  Attorney Bayer cannot access the amendment.  Court steps down so Attorney Bayer can get the documented information.  Court reconvenes.  Amended information filed.  Formal reading of the amended information waived.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Guza makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court needs additional information from the parties to consider expunction, court adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.
